noun.description: One of the two major divisions of plants, consisting of those having easily visible reproductive structures (flowers or cones) and comprising the angiosperms and the gymnosperms; (also phanerogamia) plants belonging to this division, phanerogams, spermatophytes.

origin: Early 19th century. From scientific Latin Phanerogamia from phanerogamus + -ia, after Cryptogamia.
